task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and goal, approach and align the circular end-effector to the block, establish gentle contact, then execute repeated push motions to drive the block toward the fixed goal before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace to a fixed target marker while maintaining contact-based control. The scene shows a red T block, a blue goal outline on the table, and a UR-like arm approaching from above-left. Constraints include planar pushing, alignment before contact, limited push distances per stroke, and recovery via re-approach between strokes. Observation and control occur at 10 Hz but no explicit hard time limits are given.
preconditions: T-shaped block and goal marker are visible
End-effector pose control available with yaw alignment
Contact sensing to detect gentle touch
stepwise_plan: Locate the T-shaped block and the goal marker
Move above and align to the blockâ€™s edge in the intended push direction
Lower to make light contact with the block
Execute a push stroke of fixed length toward the goal
Retreat slightly and re-align; repeat strokes
Finish by moving toward the goal region and retreating
success_criteria: Block translated into the goal region
No loss of contact during each push stroke
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, rescan the workspace
If contact is lost mid-push, retreat and re-approach
If alignment drifts, re-run ApproachAndAlign before next stroke
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after final retreat once the planned push cycles are executed and the goal zone has been reached visually.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to find the T block
Verify the T block is detected
Grid scan for the goal marker
Verify the goal marker is detected
Move to pre-contact height above block
Orient tool yaw for lateral push
Lower until gentle contact with block

assumptions: Frames show a red T block and a blue goal outline, differing from the gray/green color description; task semantics match so colors are treated as equivalent markers.

expected_success_criteria: block resides within goal outline after strokes
no collisions with table beyond gentle contact
